title: Community Associates Program: Celebrating Community Associates
hero_caption: Édouard Manet. Boating, 1874–75. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, H. O. Havemeyer Collection, Bequest of Mrs. H. O. Havemeyer.
description:
Join us for a special day of celebration in appreciation of active Community Associates members, with free programming in Rubloff Auditorium from 11:00 to 3:45. The day kicks off with a curatorial lecture by Gloria Groom on the upcoming exhibition Manet and Modern Beauty, followed by an optional light lunch in the Stock Exchange Trading Room at noon. Free refreshments will be available for all CA members in the Stock Exchange Trading Room from 1:00 to 3:00. 

The day will provide an opportunity for members to learn in community and enjoy a day of favorites—favorite artworks, speakers, people, and memories—to celebrate what Community Associates has been, what it has meant to its members, and what it has contributed to the community and the museum for over 60 years.

Program Schedule
All talks take place in Rubloff Auditorium. A printed ticket confirmation is required to be admitted to the day's programs.

11:00–11:45
Manet and Modern Beauty with Gloria Groom

12:00–12:45
Optional lunch in the Stock Exchange Trading Room for those with lunch tickets

1:00–1:25
Hokusai’s The Great Wave with Lucas Livingston

1:35–2:00
Everyone's Art Gallery: Posters of the London Underground with Teri J. Edelstein

2:10–2:35
Katharine Kuh: A Love Affair with Modern Art with Margaret Farr 

2:45–3:10
Contemporary Art: But What Does It Mean? with Annie Morse

3:20–3:45
You Are What You Wear: Fashion Statements in Art with Jeff Nigro

REGISTRATION BY PROGRAM AREA

Registration opens on Tuesday, May 7, for all Community Associates program areas. Registration links will be posted shortly in this section. Bus schedules will be posted shortly.

Pricing

  • Program–only ticket: Free
  • Optional lunch ticket (includes program ticket): $10
  • Bus ticket (specific to each CA area using a bus; includes program ticket): $20
